creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: black lacquer bull with mountainous hump with red tip rising from back; bull is decorated with various vignettes of trees, plants, clouds, animals, and people; belly painted with brighter colors; pink leather tongue sticking out of mouth; wooden legs; detachable rattan tail
markings: in green pigment, within morning glories
medium: Lacquer, wood, rattan, horn, metal, mother of pearl, shell, leather, and pigment
text: Someya unites modern pop art with traditional lacquer craft in his figurative, playful sculptures. Commissioned for the Clark Center, the back of this bull has the shape of Mount Fuji with its peak rendered in red, relating to the red sun of Japan's national flag. He decorated his work with a wide array of motifs from Japanese culture ranging from the past to the present but incorporated also elements that relate to California like Mount Whitney, the state flag, gold, and a Route 66 sign out of which emerge Japanese pine trees.
title: Mount Bull
